titlepage.titleproper: Register of the Georgie Anne Geyer Papers, 1944-1996
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California

did.head: Descriptive Summary

physdesc.label: Collection Size
physdesc.extent: 25 manuscript boxes, 9 card file boxes, 3 envelopes

did.abstract: Writings, notes, printed matter, and other research material, relating to President Fidel Castro of Cuba; Central America; and citizenship and immigration issues in the United States. Used in preparation of the books by G. A. Geyer, Guerrilla Prince: The Untold Story of Fidel Castro (Boston, 1991), and Americans No More: The Death of Citizenship (New York, 1996). Includes sound recordings and transcripts of interviews with a wide range of persons acquainted with Fidel Castro in a variety of capacities and at various periods of his life

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Georgie Anne Geyer papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1991.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Author, The New Hundred Years War

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Writings, notes, printed matter, and other research material, relating to President Fidel Castro of Cuba; Central America; and citizenship and immigration issues in the United States. Used in preparation of the books by G. A. Geyer, Guerrilla Prince: The Untold Story of Fidel Castro (Boston, 1991), and Americans No More: The Death of Citizenship (New York, 1996). Includes sound recordings and transcripts of interviews with a wide range of persons acquainted with Fidel Castro in a variety of capacities and at various periods of his life.
Drafts and printed copies of writings by Georgie Anne Geyer, with related correspondence, clippings, and miscellany. Arranged chronologically

"U.S. Role Grows in Guatemala Rebel Threat," Washington Post, 1966 December 13. Printed copy
"The Debray Case," Chicago Daily News, 1967 August. Printed copy (incomplete) and notes
"A U.S. Diplomatic Bumble?" Christian Science Monitor, 1967 January 19. Printed copy

"Tearing Up Chile," New Republic, 1970 August 29. Printed copy
"Cuba: School for U.S. Radicals," Chicago Daily News, 1970 October 12. Printed copy
"Cuba's Influence Seen in U.S. Bomb Wave," Los Angeles Times, 1970 October 13. Printed copy
"'We Threw Bombs . . . and the Whole Society Stopped,'" Los Angeles Times, 1970 October 14. Printed copy

"Hugger-Mugger in the Andes," Chicago Daily News (?), 1971 May 3. Printed copy
"Reporter Tricked, Held 3 Hours by Guerrillas," Los Angeles Times, 1973 April 14. Printed copy
"Castro Sinks His Knife into the Social Fabric of the U.S.," Chicago Sun Times, 1984 June 5. Printed copy
"Georgie Anne Geyer: 'Musolini fue el heroe de la juventud de Fidel,'" La Voz de Galicia, 1985 July 27. Printed copy
"Fidel's Fickle Way with Spain," Washington Times, 1985 August 5. Printed copy
"Tracing Castro's Roots in Brooding Galicia," Washington Times, 1985 August 12. Printed copy
"Fidel, the Lion, and the Lamb," 1985 December 4. Printed copy
"From the Bay of Pigs Arcana," Washington Times, 1986 April 23. Printed copy
"Who is Fidel Castro?" Currents in Modern Thought, 1990 May. Proofs
Miscellany. Lists, photograph reproduction requests, and letter by George Bush, 1986-1991
"Basking in the Reader's Limelight," 1991 Summer. Printed copy
"Fidel and Franco: The Ultimate Odd Couple," 1991 July 12. Printed copy
Interviews and Sources for Guerrilla Prince, 1984-1989

scopecontent.p: Typescript interview notes and transcripts, printed copies and related material including clippings, writings, and speeches. Arranged alphabetically by interviewee

did.unittitle: Alexander, William V., Jr., 1985. Includes clipping
David, Henry P., 1986. Includes related material
Diaz Balart, Rafael, 1984-1985. Includes related material

Jimenez Leal, Orlando, 1986. Includes related material

scopecontent.p: Transcript notes, and related material including correspondence, reports, and printed matter. Arranged numerically

did.unittitle: 7. Formation under Jesuits. Includes printed matter, 1944-1987
9. Romance and marriage. Includes printed matter, n.d.
10. Women in his life - attitude toward. Includes clippings, letter by Dolores Martin, and printed excerpt, 1965-1987
14. Moncada attack. Includes printed matter and a typescript by Antonio de la Coba (?), "The Attack in Bayamo," n.d.
16. Years in Sierra Maestra. Includes printed matter, 1957-1988
18. City directorate and other democrats. Includes news wire reports and printed list, n.d.
20. American Journalist in Sierra. Includes printed matter, 1967-1969
25. The non-aligned movement. Includes printed matter, 1983
29. Soviets take over economy. Includes printed matter, 1981
33. Relations with Soviets. Includes typescript report, 1968
34. Celia Sanchez. Includes printed matter, n.d.
44. American visitors. Includes printed matter, n.d.
47. Huber Matos affair. Includes printed matter, 1959-1980
50. Bogotazo. Includes printed matter and an interview with Fidel Castro, 1948-1983
53. Che. Includes printed matter and correspondence by Antonio de la Cana, Liu Yu-Wan, and William Ratliff, 1960-1985
55. Bay of Pigs. Includes printed matter, 1968-1986
60. Internal organization of Cuba: Ideologicalization and how changed. Breaking with Fidel
64. Relations with Black Americans. Includes printed matter, 1967-1982
66. Genetics and other quirks. Includes printed matter, 1984-1989
67. Spain and Galicia. Includes printed matter, 1973-1985. SEE ALSO: INTERVIEWS/Cerda, Jose de la, Conde, Francisco and Gonzalez Lopez, Emilio
72. Other books. Includes printed matter and interviews with Enrique Llaca and Angel Pino, 1986-1987. SEE ALSO: INTERVIEWS/Szulc, Tad
75. Venezuela. Includes printed matter and interviews with Fausto Amador and Beatrice Rangel, 1961-1987

scopecontent.p: Correspondence, notes, transcripts, memoranda, reports, newsletters, writings by others, press releases, biographical sketches, chronologies, and clippings and other printed matter. Arranged alphabetically by subject

did.unittitle: Betancourt, Ernesto. "Cuban Leadership After Castro," 1986. Typescript
Cabrera Infante, Guillermo. "Suicide in Cuba," n.d. Typescript and printed excerpt

Angola. Notes, chronologies, mimeograph copies of Jay Mallin, "Cuba in Angola," and Uniao Nacional para Independencia Total de Angola (UNITA), "UNITA: Daring to Challenge Soviet-Cuban Occupation in Angola," pamphlet, letter by Arnaud de Borchgrave, and printed matter, including an article by Gabriel Garcia Marquez, 1977-1988

General. Report, notes, and printed matter, 1966-1989

Vesco, Robert. Interview excerpts and printed matter, 1984-1987
Wieland, William Arthur. Newsletter, clippings, hearing transcript, and typescripts by Sarah McClendon, 1961-1965
